intro: Mesembryanthemum macellum, commonly known as the "dune morning glory," is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in the early morning, giving it its common name. Its fleshy leaves and stems are adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in sandy, coastal habitats. Mesembryanthemum macellum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and resilience.
